Asking Alex to practice with you can be a great way to improve your skills and build a stronger connection on the dance floor.

Now, about those stretches and exercises! Yes, there are specific ones that can help improve your flexibility and range of motion for salsa dancing. Focus on exercises that target your hips, legs, ankles, and core, as these areas are crucial for salsa movements. Here are some exercises and stretches to get you started:

**Hip Openers:**

1. **Piriformis stretch:** Sit on the floor with your affected leg crossed over your other leg. Place your hand on the knee of the crossed leg and pull it toward your opposite shoulder. You should feel a stretch in the back of your leg.
2. **Lying leg raises:** Lie on your back with your legs straight. Lift one leg 6-8 inches off the ground, keeping it straight, and hold for 2-3 seconds. Lower it slowly and repeat with the other leg.
3. **Glute bridges:** Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Slowly lift your hips up towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top, and then lower back down.

**Leg and Ankle Mobility:**

1. **Ankle circles:** Sit on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you. Lift one foot off the ground and draw circles with your ankle, starting from small circles and increasing in size.
2. **Calf raises:** Stand on the edge of a stair or step with your heels hanging off the edge. Raise up onto your tiptoes and then lower back down.
3. **Leg swings:** Stand with your feet hip-width apart and swing one leg forward and backward, then switch to the other leg.

**Core Strengthening:**

1. **Plank:** Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart. Engage your core and hold the position for 30-60 seconds.
2. **Russian twists:** Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Lean back slightly and twist your torso from side to side, touching your hands to the ground each time.
3. **Leg raises in plank:** Start in a plank position and raise one leg off the ground, keeping it straight. Hold for a second and then lower it back down. Repeat with the other leg.

**Additional Tips:**

1. **Warm up:** Always warm up before dancing or practicing with 5-10 minutes of light cardio and dynamic stretching.
2. **Hold stretches:** Hold each stretch for 20-30 seconds and breathe deeply, feeling the stretch in your muscles.
3. **Listen to your body:** If you experience any pain or discomfort, stop the exercise or stretch immediately.
4. **Make it a habit:** Incorporate these exercises and stretches into your daily routine, ideally 2-3 times a week, to see improvement in your flexibility and range of motion.

Remember to be patient and consistent with your stretching and exercise routine. It may take some time to notice improvements, but with regular practice, you'll be moving like a salsa pro in no time!

Keep me updated on your progress, and don't hesitate to ask if you have any more questions or need further guidance!
